snippet: Even if the economy keeps growing, prosperity could continue to elude many Americans, given forces predating the Great Recession that are depressing wage growth and widening income inequality.
abstract: Washington Memo; Democrats are split on whether to take credit for latest series of good economic news; many in party want to take middle road between claiming progress and acknowledging lingering weakness; many economists say even if economy continues to grow, many Americans will not prosper.
lead_paragraph: Even if the economy keeps growing, prosperity could continue to elude many Americans, given forces predating the Great Recession that are depressing wage growth and widening income inequality.

headline.print_headline: Good Economic News, but Democrats Differ on Whether to Take Credit
headline.main: Good Economic News, but Democrats Differ on Whether to Take Credit
